abstract: As cable TV companies pack ever more HD channels into limited bandwidth, some owners of pricey plasma, projector and LCD TVs are complaining that they’re not getting the high-def quality they paid for, the Associated Press reports. They blame the increased signal compression being used to squeeze three digital HD signals into the bandwidth of one analog station.
lead_paragraph: As cable TV companies pack ever more HD channels into limited bandwidth, some owners of pricey plasma, projector and LCD TVs are complaining that they’re not getting the high-def quality they paid for, the Associated Press reports. They blame the increased signal compression being used to squeeze three digital HD signals into the bandwidth of one analog station.

headline.main: HD Enthusiasts Crying Foul Over Cable TV’s Crunched Signals
